answers.answer: Well im not sure if an attack can kill her but she shouldnt wait to long to have it out. My mom waited years to have hers out and one day she ended up in the e.r. with a 50/50 chance of living it got so bad. It affected her pancreas and she still gets pains today even after the GB I gone. She was in the icu for a week and had to have the bile pumped out of her thru a nose tube. It was one of the worst things ever to see my mom go thru. And i cant imagine my child...And tests do show a diseased gallbladder..i never had the scope test though, i had the scan which showed my GB was diseased. Good luck i hope she gets the help she needs.
Sorry to hear that about you mom.  Thank you for so much your response and concern.
Oh my moms ok now, thankfully. But yes i would try to get your child in to see a doctor soon

question: I have a 16yr. old type 1 Diabetic (since age 11) that is having SEVERE gallbladder symtoms, All the classic such as major pain under the rt. breast, abdomen, rt. side, and rt. back, throwing up, weight loss, nausea.   She has been to her endocrinologist and we know that her diabetes is not causing these problems.  She has had a HIDA scan and it was normal.  She is scheduled for a scope to be put down her throat next week but my biggest problem is that this has been going on since Oct. 12, and because of the problems her glucose readings are all over the map, she can't go to school usually more than one day a week, on a good day, as I said earlier she has lost weight, about 10 lbs. in the last 2 months.  Her gastroenterologist says he knows that it is her gallbladder but needs a test to confirm before he will do surgery.  I don't understand.  I know from personal experience that most of the time, tests do not show a diseased gallbladder.  My child can not go on like this.  Neither can I .  I have had to miss so much work.   Please tell me what I can do.  Nothing seems to help the pain.  I give her 800mg. of Ibuprofen, but I don't like to put that into her stomach.  I'm desperate!!!CAN A GALLBLADDER ATTACK KILL HER?
title: Very Worried
